poem:
Title: "Silent Shadows at Kersal"

A crow's caw, the sun sliced on cattails
where the city's sin settles on Kersal's fringes,
A taunt of plastic shroud, too heavy with truth.
A torso, twisted mystery among the marsh marigolds,
Anonymous life now but an unfolding tragedy.
Nature, painting calm over chaos, urges peace;
Ever hopeful, we seek stories in the silent shadows.
